description.narrative: Den föreslagna Norska - Svenska programmet (programmet) om tekniskt bistånd för att förbättra genomförande och operationalisering av EAPP Coordination Centre (CC) och oberoende tillsynsmyndighet (IRB) mål byggandet av grundläggande mänskliga resurser och kompetens för att inleda regionala makten handeln under kommande 3-årsperiod.

The proposed Norwegian - Swedish Programme (the Program) on Technical Assistance for Enhancing the Implementation & Operationalization of the EAPP Coordination Centre (CC) and Independent Regulatory Body (IRB) targets building of basic human resources and skills for initiating the regional power trade during the coming 3-year period.

sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (centralised grids)

tag.narrative: 7.b - By 2030, expand infrastructure and upgrade technology for supplying modern and sustainable energy services for all in developing countries, in particular least developed countries, small island developing States and landlocked developing countries, in accordance with their respective programmes of support.

7.b - Till 2030 bygga ut infrastrukturen och uppgradera tekniken för att leverera moderna och hållbara energitjänster till alla i utvecklingsländerna, i synnerhet de minst utvecklade länderna och små önationer under utveckling.

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Overall objectives at the outset of the program: • Support efficient and effective market operations and system operation coordination and regulatory services for the regional power market. Particular focus on operationalizing the Coordination Center, CC, and Independent Regulator Board, IRB. • Initial power trade through the pilot interconnections • Create and operationalize working groups to streamline the regulation, techno-commercial operation and planning of the regional power system. • Operationalized Regional Grid Code (RGC) for the planning and technical operation of the interconnected regional power system
The plan for the period 2012-2013 involved the establishment of the technical committees, pilot exercise on system operation, implementation of a twining service, and attachments to selected national regulators in the region. Consequently, the three EAPP technical committees were set up and operationalized, attachments and pilots were carried out.
The plan for 2014 consisted mainly in the twining activities: regional master plan update, market development and system operations. These activities were all accomplished together with a “twining consultant” and with the active participation by the planning and operations committees, as well as the newly established Operations Trainers Team (OTT) and the Supervisory Control and Data Acquisitions (SCADA) Teams.
According to the final report from the engaged consultants dated 02 November 2015, the program has delivered all outputs foreseen in the project document and has been executed as per the plan. There is no independent evaluation of the results under program.
In addition to the stated objectives in the program document, SE played an active role together with USAID under Power Africa to develop a Roadmap for Regional Power Integration for EAPP. The Roadmap was adopted in early 2016 by the Council of Ministers of the EAPP and provides a comprehensive approach where different activities and benchmarks towards regional power integration are sequenced. In constructing the Roadmap, a baseline study was conducted of national energy markets and experiences were gathered from more advanced regional energy markets in Africa and beyound. MacKinsey Consultants procured by USAID provided technical backstopping together with the USAID Power Africa Team. Sweden’s role was being an honest broker in the “Power Diplomacy” between conflicting actors.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
